articles.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT Agent Casually Clicks Through 'I Am Not a Robot' Verification Test
articles.description: An anonymous reader quotes a report from Ars Technica: On Friday, OpenAI's new ChatGPT Agent, which can perform multistep tasks for users, proved it can pass through one of the Internet's most common security checkpoints by clicking Cloudflare's anti-bot veri…
articles.tweets:
tweet0: ChatGPT’s new AI agent reportedly passed the ‘I am not a robot’ test by moving a cursor like a human https://t.co/14AJrgMNgD

tweet2: OpenAI’s ChatGPT Agent casually clicks through “I am not a robot” verification test 😳

articles.title: No more links, no more scrolling—The browser is becoming an AI Agent
articles.description: With rumors about a GPT-native browser, search is shifting from finding information to fulfilling tasks. No more links, no more scrolling.
articles.tweets:
tweet0: The way agents use the internet is broken.

They don't have access to your accounts, they're blocked on half of all websites, & they take hours to set up.

Today, we're introducing @CompositeAI - the agent that connects to your browser to automate your mundane tasks. https://t.co/3f8NGOTHee
tweet1: No more links, no more scrolling—The browser is becoming an AI Agent https://t.co/wIXPT0f0Zn via @VentureBeat
tweet2: No more links, no more scrolling—The browser is becoming an AI Agent https://t.co/8n4thgpVpr https://t.co/3Ju7o7Ts3P
tweet3: The #1 use case of web browsing agents isn't ordering food/booking flights

it's using other agentic platforms. 

instead of human in the loop you have *another* agent in the loop. 

this creates a semi autonomous agent. 

this is probably how we get to agi:
- vertically agents https://t.co/M3KctQAiBK
tweet4: No more links, no more scrolling—The browser is becoming an AI Agent
https://t.co/VrqV81cIK6

articles.title: OpenAI unleashes ChatGPT agent for truly autonomous AI tasks
articles.description: OpenAI is one of the world's leading AI research labs. Founded in 2015, it's behind some of today's most talked-about tools, including GPT, DALL·E, and ChatGPT.
articles.tweets:
tweet0: ChatGPT can now do work for you using its own computer.

Introducing ChatGPT agent—a unified agentic system combining Operator’s action-taking remote browser, deep research’s web synthesis, and ChatGPT’s conversational strengths. https://t.co/7uN2Nc6nBQ
tweet1: I got early access to ChatGPT Operator.

It's OpenAI's new AI agent that autonomously takes action across the web on your behalf.

The 9 most impressive use cases I’ve tried (videos sped up):

1. Ordering dinner ingredients based on a picture and a recipe https://t.co/tdbApPELD4
tweet2: BREAKING: OpenAI just released ChatGPT agent.

I just tried it and I'm blown away.

(It did a tesco food shop for me and ordered a roast dinner with sticky toffee pudding): https://t.co/nBSxy5YWNq
tweet3: 1/ 
Browser agents are gaining serious traction 🕵️‍♀️
Just last week, OpenAI dropped the ChatGPT Agent, fully autonomous with a virtual computer, browser, terminal, and integrations like Gmail & Calendar.

It can fill forms, browse, write code, and more.

But… https://t.co/2GrJXBUEO7
tweet4: 🚨 BREAKING: OpenAI just launched ChatGPT Agent

Now, ChatGPT will browse the internet for you while solving tasks.

Here’s what just dropped and it’s wild: 🧵👇 https://t.co/fhMLG0BaR4

articles.title: Getting into Flow State with Agentic Coding
articles.description:
I recently found myself in a deep state of flow while coding — the kind where time melts away and you gain real clarity about the software you’re building. The difference this time: I was using Claude Code primarily.
If my recent posts are any indication, I’v…
articles.tweets:
tweet0: Getting Into Flow State with Agentic Coding

I recently found myself in a deep state of flow while coding with agents. I put together a workflow that seems to work for me, and I’m sharing the details and exact prompts I use in case it’s useful to others. https://t.co/yQrg4kKDrb
tweet1: my new vibe code setup: 

1 orchestrator agent which controls 85 sub-agents working in parallel

each sub-agent spawns from my stream of consciousness and tests from the main orchestrator

Here's how it works: https://t.co/KernOoHjy7
tweet2: Getting Into Flow State with Agentic Coding - Kaushik Gopal's Website https://t.co/bNJwzWWo4I
tweet3: Getting into Flow State with Agentic Coding https://t.co/fTGSWznr6l (https://t.co/KOyFfpbHpO)
tweet4: With new @figma variables. We can create any number of flow using conditions on a single frame. Testing a free flow character movement. Also tried to detect object and it worked. Small demo for something big we can create. Shared some logics below 🤩 https://t.co/PpBlYzTBx2

articles.title: Crush: The glamourous AI coding agent for your favourite terminal

articles.title: Attorney ‘unapologetically’ prosecutes ICE agent assailants with federal criminal charges
articles.description: U.S. Attorney for the Central District of California Bill Essayli details the criminal charges facing those who ‘obstruct, assault’ I.C.E. agents on ‘America...
articles.tweets:
tweet0: 🚨 BREAKING: The medical workers in California who decided to block ICE agents from arresting an illegal have NOW BEEN CRIMINALLY CHARGED, per Fox. 

The man is in custody. The woman will be soon.

FAFO. 

It doesn’t fly under 47. 
 https://t.co/yr5jDaL3pt
tweet1: This sure looks like obstruction of justice. Our brave ICE law enforcement face a 500% increase in assaults against them. 

If you obstruct or assault our law enforcement, we will hunt you down and you will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law. https://t.co/4ZcfrpyRV1
tweet2: "We've already shown, you put a hand on an ice officer, you can be prosecuted to the highest extents of the law. We're not playing with any threats against ICE officers."

— Tom Homan, border czar, on the increase of assaults and doxing of ICE agents and officials

@RealTomHoman https://t.co/xrEo9i02Ru
tweet3: Arrest them all! 
Encouraging gangs and others to rise against – or kill – ICE officers is a crime, and you will be prosecuted.  —ICE Acting Director Todd 
https://t.co/vFG6tFnw7k
tweet4: Acting U.S. Attorney Nancy Larson announces attempted murder charges against the 10 individuals who planned an 
ambush with the INTENT to kill ICE officers.

This is how it’s done. The gold standard for lawlessness. 
 https://t.co/Eqmjl09GPb

articles.title: Google’s Mueller Advises Testing Ecommerce Sites For Agentic AI via @sejournal, @martinibuster
articles.description:
Google's John Mueller advises checking whether your ecommerce store is accessible to AI agents.
The post Google’s Mueller Advises Testing Ecommerce Sites For Agentic AI appeared first on Search Engine Journal.
articles.tweets:
tweet0: The #1 use case of web browsing agents isn't ordering food/booking flights

it's using other agentic platforms. 

instead of human in the loop you have *another* agent in the loop. 

this creates a semi autonomous agent. 

this is probably how we get to agi:
- vertically agents https://t.co/M3KctQAiBK
tweet1: AI Dominance in E-Commerce Has a New Focus: Agentic Checkout Technology
🤖 AI-driven agentic checkout is transforming the online shopping experience
🛒 Streamlines and personalizes the checkout process for consumers
🚀 Boosts conversion rates and reduces cart abandonment for https://t.co/FhkNjH3JUN
tweet2: Google Shopping just now made so many AI Apps irrelevant with its new AI feature.

Google just released a blog post highlighting AI try on feature in Google shopping.

You can easily try on billions of apparel items across Search, Google Shopping and even product results on https://t.co/t0oT7aGS1V
tweet3: Google just declared war on Amazon.

Their new AI weaponized 50 billion products against every retailer on Earth.

No more scrolling. No more comparing. No more checkout.

Here’s how they’re ending ecom as we know it (and the once-in-a-decade opportunity it just created):🧵 https://t.co/hhefZJyxls
tweet4: If I were launching an ecom store from scratch today, I wouldn’t hire.

I’d deploy 100+ of these AI agents trained on billions of commerce events.

Shopify jointly invested $25M into that idea.

I tested it myself. 👀

Here are the incredible things it can do: https://t.co/vox4J8Pvp6
